default: (a) a {@item shield|PHB} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|type=simple weapon=sand|category=basic}
(a) a {@item component pouch|PHB} or (b) an {@item arcane focus|PHB} or {@item druidic focus|PHB}
(a) a {@item explorer's pack|PHB} or (b) an {@item dungeoneer's pack|PHB}

classFeature.name: Optional Rule: Alternate Ability Hunter
entries: Hunters usually rely on their instincts, governed by Wisdom, their awareness of the world around them. But you may prefer that your Hunter gains an advantage through their wit and quick thinking, or their unbreakable resolve fueling their efforts.
If this is the case for your Hunter, you may prefer to use Intelligence or Charisma instead of Wisdom for your Hunter features. If you do so, make the following changes:

items: Features which specify your Wisdom modifier (such as Supreme Quarry) instead use the modifier of the chosen ability.
Your Hunter DC is calculated with that ability, instead of Wisdom.

classFeature.name: Instinct
entries: Hunters rely on their senses and instincts. You can apply yours more keenly than most creatures, granting you an edge in combat that you can exploit in various ways. Your Instinct recovers on a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.

You also have a Hunter's Die, which determines the damage or bonus granted by some of your features. You have an amount of Instinct equal to your Hunter level plus two (as indicated in the Hunter Table) and additional equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 0).

classFeature.name: Quarry
entries: A Hunter needs a target. Once per turn, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} and a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to designate a creature within 60 feet of you as your Quarry, the target of your hunt. The designation lasts for up to one hour, and when you hit that creature with an attack, you deal additional damage equal to your Hunter's Die of the same type as your weapon. You can have only one Quarry at a time.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: Your skills as a warrior are commendable, and you gain a {@filter Fighting Style Feat|feats|category=FS} of your choice.
Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace that Fighting Style feat with another.

classFeature.name: Survival Instincts
entries: A gut instinct guides your senses. Whenever you make an ability check using {@skill Perception|XPHB} or {@skill Survival|XPHB}, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to add your Hunter's Die to the roll total.

activation.condition: When you make a Perception or Survival check

classFeature.name: Tricks
entries: A Hunter is flexible, able to adapt their skillset to most threats. These Tricks are combat techniques, unique skills or benefits to your skills, or modifications to your defenses. They may be informed by your Hunting Grounds.

At 2nd level, you know 2 {@filter Tricks|optionalfeatures|feature type=HTR}, and learn more as indicated in the Tricks column of the Hunter table. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change one Trick for another that you qualify for, represented by your preparations for the day ahead.

If a Trick has prerequisites, you must meet them to gain that Trick. You can gain a Trick at the same time you meet its prerequisites. A level prerequisite refers to your level in this class. If you lose the prerequisite for a Trick, for example you change one Trick that another depends on, you may replace it with another Trick for which you meet the prerequisite.
Your Hunter features and Tricks share the same DC if they require a saving throw:

classFeature.name: Shrug It Off
entries: It takes a significant hit to phase you. Once per {@variantrule Short Rest}, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} and a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to roll your Hunter's Die twice, add your Hunter level, and gain Temporary Hit Points equal to the total.

classFeature.name: Keen Eye
entries: When you make an attack roll against your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to add your Hunter's Die to the roll.

activation.condition: When you make an attack roll against your Quarry

classFeature.name: Hunting Grounds
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you distinguish yourself from other Hunters by calling on the skills developed in your Hunting Grounds, the place you honed your skills. Your Hunting Grounds grant you features at 3rd level, and again at 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Hunter levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Measured Quarry
entries: Choose a hunting discipline. When you designate your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, you gain the associated benefit.

classFeature.name: Relentless Approach
entries: Your Quarry cannot {@condition Frighten} you.

classFeature.name: Watchful Approach
entries: Your Quarry cannot {@condition Charm} you.

classFeature.name: Tactical Approach
entries: You learn your Quarry's resistances, vulnerabilities or immunities to any damage or conditions.

classFeature.name: Offensive Hunter
entries: At 6th level, your skill as a Hunter have grown and you develop new techniques to fell larger foes or to cleave through their minions. Choose one of the following:

classFeature.name: Focused Assault
entries: You deal an additional {@dice 1d4} damage when you damage a creature that is below its maximum hit points.

classFeature.name: Considered Strikes
entries: You score a critical hit on attacks when rolling a 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}. Whenever you roll a critical hit, you deal additional damage equal to one roll of your Hunter's Die.

classFeature.name: Thin the Herd
entries: Once on each of your turns when you attack a creature, you can immediately make another attack against a different creature within 10 feet of the target that is within your reach or range.

classFeature.name: Sixth Sense
entries: You can mark your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} without being able to see them and within a range of 600 feet. You have advantage on any Wisdom or Intelligence checks made to find your Quarry or see through its illusions, and your quarry lasts up to eight hours.

classFeature.name: Hunting Grounds Feature
entries: When you reach 7th level, you gain another feature from your Hunting Grounds.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Hunter levels 12 and 16.

classFeature.name: Pressured Quarry
entries: Choose a hunting discipline. When you designate your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, you gain that benefit.

classFeature.name: Relentless Pressure
entries: When you hit your Quarry with an attack, all other attacks you make against your Quarry before the start of your have a +3 bonus to hit until the start of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Watchful Guard
entries: When your Quarry deals damage to you with a feature that targets only you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to halve the damage you take from that feature.

activation.condition: When your Quarry deals damage to you with a feature that targets only you

description.chatFlavor: Your careful watch lets you protect yourself from danger. Take half damage from the triggering effect.

classFeature.name: Tactical Disruption
entries: After your Quarry makes an attack roll, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to impose a penalty to the roll equal to your Hunter's Die. At the additional cost of one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, you can do this when your Quarry makes a saving throw.

activation.condition: When your Quarry makes an attack roll
When your Quarry makes a saving throw

classFeature.name: Defensive Hunter
entries: At 10th level, your skill as a Hunter have grown further and you develop new techniques to help you evade danger. Choose one of the following:

classFeature.name: Quickstep
entries: Creatures cannot make opportunity attacks against you.

classFeature.name: Pattern Recognition
entries: After a creature hits you with an attack, you gain a +4 bonus to your {@variantrule Armour Class|XPHB|AC} against all other attacks made by that creature until the end of its turn.

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

classFeature.name: Hunting Grounds Feature
entries: When you reach 11th level, you gain another feature from your Hunting Grounds.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Hunter level 16.

classFeature.name: Cornered Quarry
entries: Choose a hunting discipline. When you designate your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, you gain that benefit.

classFeature.name: Relentless Strikes
entries: Your attacks against your Quarry deal additional damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.

classFeature.name: Watchful Poise
entries: You have an additional 5 feet of reach when attempting to attack your Quarry with a melee weapon. If you use a ranged weapon, you do not suffer disadvantage on attacks outside of the weapon's normal range that are made against your Quarry.

classFeature.name: Tactical Isolation
entries: When you attack your Quarry, you can instead end the Quarry and make an attack against every other creature of your choice within your reach (if you use a melee weapon), or within 10 feet of your quarry (if you use a ranged weapon).

classFeature.name: Refined Instincts
entries: You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws, and one of your choice of Charisma or Intelligence saving throws.
When you fail a saving throw, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to add your Hunter's Die to the roll, potentially turning it into a success.

activation.condition: When you fail a saving throw

classFeature.name: Hunting Grounds Feature
entries: When you reach 15th level, you gain another feature from your Hunting Grounds.

classFeature.name: Supernatural Hunter
entries: Your skills as a Hunter grow again, to the extent that your abilities seem almost supernatural. Choose one of the following abilities, which you can use once per {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}:

classFeature.name: Vanish
entries: You can spend a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to become {@condition Invisible|XPHB} until the end of your next turn. While invisible, you can pass through objects and creatures, and cannot be {@condition Grappled} or {@condition Restrained}. If you end your turn within an object or creature's space, you take {@dice 3d10} force damage and are shunted to the nearest available space.

classFeature.name: Blur
entries: You double your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} this turn (no action required). If you take damage before the start of your next turn, any movement you didn't use on your turn can instead be used to reduce that damage, spending 1 feet of unused movement for every 1 point of damage.

classFeature.name: Reaper
entries: Attacks made as part of the {@action Attack} action this turn deal additional damage equal to your Hunter's Die. If you reduce a creature to zero hit points with these attacks, you can take another {@variantrule Action} this turn.

classFeature.name: Doomed Quarry
entries: Choose a hunting discipline. When you designate your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, you gain that benefit.

classFeature.name: Relentless Assault
entries: You have advantage on attacks against your Quarry.

classFeature.name: Watchful Resolve
entries: You have advantage on any saving throws you make against your Quarry and its effects.

classFeature.name: Tactical Dominance
entries: You force your Quarry's attention, protecting your allies. The first time each turn your Quarry targets one of your allies, your Quarry has disadvantage on its attack (if it attacks), or that ally has resistance to any damage dealt and advantage on any saving throws they are forced to make by your Quarry.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon Feat|feats|category=EB} or another {@filter feat|feats|} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Hunter's Zenith
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and so does your Strength or Dexterity score (you choose), both up to a maximum of 30.

You can have up to two creatures as your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} at any one time, and when you mark one you can mark another at no cost. Choosing another Quarry only ends your previous Quarry if you would have more than two, in which case you choose which to end.
At this level, you also gain access to a unique and powerful Trick: Relentless, Watchful, or Tactical Hunter.

subclassFeature.name: Edge of the World
entries: Borderland Hunters walk on the borders of the Material Plane and its mirror, the Feywilds, stalking the creatures that live there. Living in shades of grey and dim light, they have mastered the borders and can briefly change where they reside, striking terror no matter where a creature escapes to.

subclassFeature.name: Skills from the Borderland
entries: {@i 3rd-level Borderland Hunter feature}
Your experience in dealing with creatures of the between-realm has given you skills related to reading intention and concealing your own.
You gain proficiency with two of the following skills: {@skill Insight|XPHB}, {@skill Deception|XPHB}, {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}, or {@skill Arcana|XPHB}.
Additionally, you gain proficiency with {@item Navigator's tools|XPHB} and {@item Herbalism Kit|XPHB}, so you are never lost, and can identify the dangerous flora of the feywilds.

subclassFeature.name: Border-world Quarries
entries: {@i 3rd-level Borderland Hunter feature}
Ghosts and Fae... tricksy, aye. Lucky for you, there's a fancy fire that should still get 'em sweating!
When you damage your Qua{@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}rry, you can choose for the additional damage dealt by your Hunter's Die to be Radiant damage.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Shift
entries: {@i 3rd-level Borderland Hunter feature}

You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to shift into a state between the planes. While in this state, which lasts for one minute, you can move through other creatures freely. If you move through a creature this way, they take necrotic damage equal to a roll of your Hunter's Die. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.
If you end your turn in another creature's space, you are shunted harmlessly to the nearest available space. Ethereal Shift ends if you become {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} or die.
You can use this feature for free once per {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, otherwise it costs two {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}.

subclassFeature.name: Expert
entries: {@i 7th-level Borderland Hunter feature}

The skills you gained from the Borderlands have improved. You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in the skills you chose, and one of the tools from, your {@subclassFeature Skills from the Borderland|Hunter|Starlight|Borderland|Starlight|3|Starlight|Skills from the Borderland} feature.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Shift Improvement
entries: {@i 7th-level Borderland Hunter feature}
While using Ethereal Shift, you can cast {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} once on each of your turns (no spell slot required).

subclassFeature.name: Fae Tricks
entries: {@i 11th-level Borderland Hunter feature}

When a creature hits you with an attack, spell, or other effect while you are using Ethereal Shift, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to end Ethereal Shift and teleport up to 30 feet away, potentially causing the effect to miss.
Regardless of if you evade the effect, the attacking creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or take {@dice 4d8} psychic damage. This damage increases to {@dice 5d10} at level 15.

subclassFeature.name: Grave Step
entries: {@i 15th-level Borderland Hunter feature}
While using Ethereal Shift, you have {@sense Truesight|XPHB} out to a range of 30 feet.

Additionally, the necrotic damage you deal by passing through a creature's space increases to two rolls of your Hunter's Die. When you cast Misty Step using Ethereal Shift, you can deal this damage to all creatures in a 5-foot line between the space you teleport from and your destination.

subclassFeature.name: Planeswalker
entries: Extraplanar Hunters walk the outer planes, dealing with Celestials, Demons and Aberrations alike. Time spent in these outer regions inevitably grants a taste of the power these creatures wield, which Extraplanar Hunters manipulate to their own end. They may protect other planes from these creatures, go on missions in these areas, or simply live their lives there.

subclassFeature.name: Skills from the Outer Planes
entries: {@i 3rd-level Extraplanar Hunter feature}
Your experience in the outer planes has taught you much about magic and the beliefs and mythologies of others.
You gain proficiency with 2 of the following skills: {@skill Arcana|XPHB}, {@skill Religion|XPHB}, {@skill Insight}, or {@skill Persuasion}.

Additionally, you gain proficiency with any {@item Gaming Set|XPHB} and {@item Cook's Utensils}, as some creatures from these planes are known to enjoy games, and their food may not be to your liking.

subclassFeature.name: Outer-planes Quarries
entries: {@i 3rd-level Extraplanar Hunter feature}
You gotta deal with a wide range of creatures in the outer planes, nothing works against all of them. So try to hit it where it hurts: right between the eyes.
When you damage your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, you can choose for the additional damage dealt by your Hunter's Die to be Psychic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Gift
entries: {@i 3rd-level Extraplanar Hunter feature}

Your exposure to otherworldly magics has given you access to a pool of energy you can derive power from. It can hold a number of your Hunter's Die equal to your Proficiency Bonus and refills when you complete a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. When you damage your Quarry, you can add one Hunter's Die to the pool.

subclassFeature.name: Aberrant Ward
entries: {@i 3rd-level Extraplanar Hunter feature}

Pulling from the Psionic Powers of Aberrations, you can protect your allies. When an ally within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll any number of dice from your Planar Gift, reducing the damage they take by the total rolled.

activation.condition: When a nearby ally takes damage

subclassFeature.name: Expert
entries: {@i 7th-level Extraplanar Hunter feature}

The skills you gained from the outer planes have improved. You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in the skills you chose, and one of the tools from, your {@subclassFeature Skills from the Outer Planes|Hunter|Starlight|Urban|Starlight|3|Starlight|Skills from the Outer Planes feature}.

subclassFeature.name: Celestial Dusting
entries: {@i 7th-level Extraplanar Hunter feature}
When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can spend and roll one die from your Planar Gift to grant that many temporary hit points to yourself or a creature within 10 feet of you.
If you damage your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, you can instead use the Hunter's Die rolled as part of the attack.

activation.condition: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack

subclassFeature.name: Infernal Edge
entries: {@i 11th-level Extraplanar Hunter feature}

Once per turn, you can use a die from your Planar Gift to attempt to poison a creature when you hit them with a weapon attack. The target takes additional necrotic damage equal to a roll of your Hunter's Die, and must make a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} until the end of your next turn.

activation.condition: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack

subclassFeature.name: Planar Boon
entries: {@i 15th-level Extraplanar Hunter feature}
Your gifts from the outer planes have grown in power:

items: Aberrant Ward now pushes the attacking creature 10 feet away from the ally you protect with it.
Celestial Dusting can also be used to restore hit points to a creature, and its range is 30 feet.
Infernal Edge imposes disadvantage on the saving throw if your target is a Fiend, Celestial or Aberration.

subclassFeature.name: Bounty Hunter
entries: Those who hunt in this environment have a unique challenge. Finding one creature in a crowd, instead of a forest. Vertical, cramped terrain, with winding alleys and hidden paths. And a thousand places to disappear in plain sight. Urban Hunters cut through this noise, finding their marks and stopping them from getting away - if they ever saw you in the first place.

subclassFeature.name: Skills from the City
entries: {@i 3rd-level Urban Hunter feature}
Your experience navigating the cities has taught you how to find secrets, and how to get your way.
You gain proficiency with two of the following three skills: {@skill Investigation|XPHB}, {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}, and {@skill Intimidation|XPHB}.
Additionally, you gain proficiency with {@item Forgery Kit|XPHB|Forgery Kits} and {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, to help you gain access to well-guarded places.

subclassFeature.name: Everyman Quarries
entries: {@i 3rd-level Urban Hunter feature}
Poison isn't what it used to be, and if you're a good soul you'll be hunting assassins yourself. It's a rare citygoer who can resist something like this, though.
When you damage your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, you can choose for the additional damage dealt by your Hunter's Die to be Necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Cripple Foe
entries: {@i 3rd-level Urban Hunter feature}
The best way to chase a creature is to prevent them getting away in the first place.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to make a special attack against a target within your reach or range; they must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they are {@condition Slowed|Starlight} and take damage equal to a roll of your Hunter's Die plus your Wisdom modifier. On a successful save, they are {@condition Hampered|Starlight} and take half damage instead.

subclassFeature.name: Expert
entries: {@i 7th-level Urban Hunter feature}

Your city-life skills have improved. You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in the skills you chose, and one of the tools from, your {@subclassFeature Skills from the City|Hunter|Starlight|Urban|Starlight|3|Starlight|Skills from the City} feature.

subclassFeature.name: Seeker
entries: {@i 7th-level Urban Hunter feature}

You have a knack for finding people. You can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} and an {@variantrule Action} to sense the direction to a creature as per the {@spell Locate Creature|XPHB} spell. This lasts for ten minutes and does not require your {@status concentration|concentrating}.

subclassFeature.name: Silent Killer
entries: {@i 11th-level Urban Hunter feature}
You can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

While unseen by a creature, you can replace one attack from your {@action Attack} action with a stealth strike. On hit, the target must make an Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition Silenced|Starlight} and {@condition Deafened|XPHB} until the start of your next turn, they take additional damage equal to your Hunter's Die, and your position is not revealed. You can do this only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Opportunist
entries: {@i 15th-level Urban Hunter feature}

When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points, you can immediately move up to half your speed without provoking {@variantrule Opportunity Attacks}. As part of this movement, you can take the {@action Hide} action, and if you end the movement hidden then you become {@condition Invisible} until the end of your next turn.
The invisibility ends if you make an attack or force a creature to make a saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Beast Hunter
entries: Horizon Hunters strive to be the best, hunting anything from sky to sea. They weaken their quarries in speed in strength, claim trophies from their strikes and even have the expertise to handle packs of creatures. They might do it for fame and fortune, they might do it to protect the innocent from the dangers of the wild, or they might simply hunt for the thrill of bettering themselves.

subclassFeature.name: Skills from the Wilds
entries: {@i 3rd-level Horizon Hunter feature}
In order to hunt beasts, you must travel far and learn how to cope with animals of all temperaments and sizes.
You gain proficiency with two of the following three skills: {@skill Animal Handling|XPHB}, {@skill Athletics|XPHB}, and {@skill Survival|XPHB}.
Additionally, you gain proficiency with piloting air or water vehicles, and with a {@item Navigator's Tools|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Quarries
entries: {@i 3rd-level Horizon Hunter feature}
If you must slay beasts, I don't know a beast alive that's a fan of fire. Hopefully by the time you find one that {@i doesn't} mind fire, you can work your way around that.
When you damage your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, you can choose for the additional damage dealt by your Hunter's Die to be Fire damage.

subclassFeature.name: Declaw
entries: {@i 3rd-level Horizon Hunter feature}

You can attempt to cripple your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}. Once per turn when you make a successful attack with the {@variantrule Attack|XPHB|Attack action} against your Quarry, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to force it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you can disable one of its attack options (the DM chooses which) until the start of your next turn. If you forgo dealing damage, it has disadvantage on the saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Trophies
entries: {@i 3rd-level Horizon Hunter feature}

When you roll a 20 on an attack roll against your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, it drops a trophy, an item of significance such as a serpent's venomous fang. You can sell a Trophy in your downtime for 10gp times the creature's CR. At your DM's discretion, you may require a Wisdom (Survival) check and {@dice 1d4} days to find a suitable buyer - in these cases, the item may sell for more.

subclassFeature.name: Expert
entries: {@i 7th-level Horizon Hunter feature}

Your skills from the wild have improved. You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in the skills you chose, and one of the tools from, your {@subclassFeature Skills from the Wilds|Hunter|Starlight|Urban|Starlight|3|Starlight|Skills from the Wilds} feature.

subclassFeature.name: Roaming
entries: {@i 7th-level Horizon Hunter feature}
Your walking speed increases by 10 feet, and you gain a Climb and Swim speed equal to your walking speed.
You can hold your breath underwater for an additional number of minutes equal to your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Pack Hunting
entries: {@i 7th-level Horizon Hunter feature}
When your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} dies, you can designate another creature of the same type as your Quarry immediately (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Siphon Speed
entries: {@i 11th-level Horizon Hunter feature}

Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack, you can deal extra damage equal to your Hunter's Die and force it to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature is {@condition Slowed|Starlight} until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Apex Hunter
entries: {@i 15th-level Horizon Hunter feature}
When a creature fails their saving throw against Siphon Speed, your movement speeds are replaced with theirs until the start of your next turn, unless yours are higher.
When you hit your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, its immunities are treated as resistance, and you bypass its resistances.

subclassFeature.name: Storyteller
entries: Fable Hunters gained their knowledge from study, and almost all of them have a common goal: to be a Hunter that would be discussed in the very books and tales they learned from. A Fable Hunter aims to live forever, immortalised in stories told around a fireplace and studies of combat strategy. A Fable Hunter wants to take on creatures of Legendary power; and a Fable Hunter wants to win. To this end, they learn their foe, and direct their allies to victory. Success comes before personal glory.

{@note A 'Legendary Creature' is one that has Legendary (or similar, such as Mythic) actions. Typically, having a Lair Action would not qualify a creature. Work with your DM to define what a legendary creature means in your campaign.}

subclassFeature.name: Skills of Yore
entries: {@i 3rd-level Fable Hunter feature}
For your tale to be told, you must develop the quick wits and knowledge to tell it.
You gain proficiency with two of the following skills: {@skill Perception|XPHB}, {@skill Nature|XPHB}, and {@skill Performance|XPHB}.
Additionally, you gain proficiency with {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB} and {@item Woodcarver's Tools}, to keep your group well-supplied.

subclassFeature.name: Epic Quarries
entries: {@i 3rd-level Fable Hunter feature}
The toughest creatures earned their rep', and they come in all shapes and sizes. Getting past defenses like that is tricky for even the strongest mages... but you might have a way.
When you damage your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, you can choose for the additional damage dealt by your Hunter's Die to be Force damage.

subclassFeature.name: Commander
entries: {@i 3rd-level Fable Hunter feature}

Whenever you make an attack with the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can instead spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to command an ally. The ally you choose can use their {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to their {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, or make an attack against your Quarry. The attack has a bonus to the damage roll equal to a roll of your Hunter's Die.

activation.condition: When you make an attack and command an ally to attack instead

subclassFeature.name: Expert
entries: {@i 7th-level Fable Hunter feature}

Your story-making skills have grown. You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in the skills you chose, and one of the tools from, from your {@subclassFeature Skills of Yore|Hunter|Starlight|Urban|Starlight|3|Starlight|} feature.

subclassFeature.name: Rally
entries: {@i 7th-level Fable Hunter feature}

Whenever you make an attack with the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can instead spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to inspire a friendly creature within 60 feet of you. That creature gains temporary hit points equal to a roll of your Hunter's Die plus your Wisdom modifier, and their next successful attack deals additional damage equal to your Hunter's Die.

activation.condition: When you take the Attack action and choose to inspire an ally instead

description.chatFlavor: An ally within 60 feet gains temporary hit points and their next successful attack deals additional damage equal to your Hunter's Die.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter's Call
entries: {@i 11th-level Fable Hunter feature}

Once per {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} and one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to mark one target with a special Quarry until the start of your next turn. Whenever any creature deals damage to the target, they deal additional damage equal to your Hunter's Die.

subclassFeature.name: Commanding Shout
entries: {@i 15th-level Fable Hunter feature}

Once per {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to imbue allies within 30 feet of you with epic tenacity. Until the end of your next turn, affected creatures cannot be reduced below one hit point or killed, their {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} cannot be reduced, and they cannot be {@condition Stunned|XPHB} or {@condition Restrained|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Resilience
entries: {@i 15th-level Fable Hunter feature}

When you are targeted by a Legendary Action (and similar actions such as Mythic Actions), you can either gain advantage on a saving throw you are forced to make against it or gain resistance to any damage dealt by it.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Reactions
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative}, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to roll your Hunter's Die and add it to the total. You can do so after the roll.

activation.condition: When you roll Initiative

optionalfeature.name: Hunter's Insight
entries: You have a knack for reading people and their intentions. You can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to add your Hunter's Die to any ability check you make using the {@skill Insight|XPHB} or {@skill Deception|XPHB} skill. You can do this after the roll, and if this turns the roll from a failure to a success, you regain the Instinct you spent.

activation.condition: When you make an ability check using Insight or Deception

optionalfeature.name: Heavy Training
entries: You gain proficiency with Heavy Armour.

optionalfeature.name: Trip Attack
entries: You can attempt to trip a creature when you hit with an attack. You can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} when you hit a creature to force it to make a Strength saving throw against your Hunter DC, falling {@condition Prone|XPHB} if it fails.

activation.condition: When you

optionalfeature.name: Retaliate
entries: When a creature hits you with an attack, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} and a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make an attack against that creature, adding your Hunter's Die to the attack roll.

activation.condition: When a creature hits you with an attack

optionalfeature.name: Driving Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to force the target to make a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from you.

activation.condition: When you hit a creature with an attack

optionalfeature.name: Dazzling Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can spend two {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to force the target to make a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition Disoriented|Starlight}.

activation.condition: When you hit a creature with an attack

optionalfeature.name: Finder of Traps
entries: You can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} and a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to sense the location and purpose of any traps (and their triggers) within 60 feet of you.
A trap is any object or mechanism that was created or placed to cause damage or other danger. This could include spells, physical mechanisms, or even dangerous loopholes in a contract.

optionalfeature.name: Trapsetter
entries: At the start of each day, you can improvise {@item Ball Bearings|XPHB}, {@item Caltrops|XPHB}, {@item Acid|XPHB} or {@item Oil|XPHB}. You can {@action Utilize|XPHB} this improvised item with a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} instead of replacing an attack or using the {@action Utilize|XPHB} action.
Once created, the item lasts for 24 hours or until you improvise another, which costs 10gp and takes ten minutes.

optionalfeature.name: Preparations
entries: You can plan ahead when you know what the day holds.

At the start of each day, you can prepare a number of special coatings equal to your Proficiency Bonus. These coatings provide a +1 bonus to attack rolls and deal {@dice 1d4} additional damage of a damage type of your choosing other than force or psychic.
You can apply these to an arrow or other weapon with no action cost, but only one can be used at a time. The coatings retain their potency for 24 hours or until used, whereupon they last one minute.

optionalfeature.name: Naturally Talented
entries: You gain proficiency in a Hunter skill you are not already proficient in (Athletics, Acrobatics, Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Stealth, Survival), then you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in one that you are proficient in.

optionalfeature.name: Trained in Darkness
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, its range is increased by 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Parry
entries: When you are hit by an attack, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} and your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to reduce the damage by a number of rolls of your Hunter's Die equal to half your proficiency bonus (round up) plus your Wisdom modifier.

activation.condition: When you are hit by an attack

optionalfeature.name: Cleaving Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can spend two {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to make an additional attack against a different creature within 5 feet of the original target.

optionalfeature.name: Readied Strike
entries: When a creature enters your reach and you are holding a melee weapon, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make an {@action Opportunity Attack} against them, adding your Hunter's Die to the attack roll.

activation.condition: When a creature enters your reach and you are holding a melee weapon

optionalfeature.name: Environmental Conditioning
entries: Your exposure to a range of creatures and environments has taught you how to prepare for many a situation.

When you complete a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can choose to become resistant to your choice of fire, cold, acid, lightning or thunder damage. This resistance lasts until you select another resistance through this feature.
resist: fire, cold, acid, lightning, or thunder

optionalfeature.name: Superior Stamina I
entries: You can take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, or with no action required at the cost of one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}

optionalfeature.name: Staggering Blow
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to attempt to impede your opponent's coordination.
The target must make a Strength saving throw or be {@condition Staggered|S: Conditions} until the start of your next turn.

activation.condition: When you hit a creature with an attack

optionalfeature.name: Sundering Blow
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to attempt to temporarily weaken your opponent's armour.
The target must make a Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition Sundered|S: Conditions} until the start of your next turn.

activation.condition: When you hit a creature with an attack

optionalfeature.name: Hampering Attack
entries: Your attacks are aimed such that they affect your opponent's movement. When you hit a creature with an attack, it becomes {@condition Hampered} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Pocket Sand
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} and one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to attempt to {@condition Blinded|XPHB|blind} a creature. Choose a creature within 5 feet of you. It must make a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Blinded|XPHB} until the start of your next turn. You must have a free hand to use this Trick.

optionalfeature.name: Instinctual Mark
entries: You can mark a creature as your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} without using your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, at the cost of two {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}.

optionalfeature.name: Shrug it Off Improvement
entries: When you use Shrug It Off, you can roll an additional Hunter's Die when determining the Temporary Hit Points gained.

As part of that {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can choose to spend additional {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, rolling one additional Hunter's Die for each Instinct spent.
Finally, you can use Shrug It Off to recover Hit Points, instead of gaining Temporary Hit Points.

optionalfeature.name: Sterner Stuff I
entries: You have resistance to poison damage and advantage on any saving throws made against the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Indefatigable I
entries: You can remove one level of {@condition exhaustion} whenever you complete a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Cunning Hunter I
entries: When you make a Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) or Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand|XPHB}) check, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to add your Hunter's Die to the total.

activation.condition: When you make a Dexterity (Stealth or Sleight of Hand) check.

optionalfeature.name: Sliding Attack
entries: You are especially manoeuvrable. You can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} and an {@variantrule Action|XPHB} to do a special {@action Dash|XPHB} which allows you to move through other creature's spaces and not provoke opportunity attacks. Once per turn, if you move through a creature's space as part of this, you can make one attack with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} against that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Power Attack
entries: When you make an attack against your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, you can subtract your Proficiency Bonus from the attack roll and add your Hunter's Die to the attack's damage.

activation.condition: When you make an attack against your Quarry

optionalfeature.name: Deft Movement I
entries: You can take the {@action Disengage} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action}, or with no action required at the cost of one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}.

optionalfeature.name: Naturally Gifted
entries: You gain proficiency in any skill that you are not proficient in, then you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in one that you are proficient in.

optionalfeature.name: Superior Stamina II
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Preceding Reputation
entries: You can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to add your Hunter's Die to an ability check that uses the {@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, {@skill Persuasion|XPHB} or {@skill Performance|XPHB} skills.

activation.condition: When you make an ability check using Intimidation, Persuasion, or Performance

optionalfeature.name: Honed Senses
entries: Your additional {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} is equal to twice your Wisdom modifier, instead of once.

optionalfeature.name: Eye on the Prize
entries: Opportunity attacks made against your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} do not require your {@variantrule Reaction}.

optionalfeature.name: Indefatigable II
entries: Once per turn when you regain hit points, including each time you roll a Hit Die during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can regain an additional amount equal to your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Deft Movement II
entries: Your speed cannot be reduced unless a condition sets it to 0 directly.

You have {@variantrule Advantage} on saving throws and ability checks made to avoid the {@condition Grappled}, {@condition Restrained}, or {@condition Paralysed} conditions, and to escape manacles or similar restraints.

optionalfeature.name: Disarming Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to force it to make a Strength saving throw or let go of or drop an object of your choice that it is holding. The object lands in the creature's space if possible.

activation.condition: When you hit a creature with an attack

optionalfeature.name: Sterner Stuff II
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage and advantage on saving throws against the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} or {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} conditions.

optionalfeature.name: Cunning Hunter II
entries: You are untraceable. You make no sound when Hiding and cannot be tracked or seen by Divination or other magic unless you choose to be.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless Hunter
entries: Attacks you make against your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} bypass damage resistance, and treat damage immunity as resistance.

optionalfeature.name: Watchful Hunter
entries: When an effect would reduce you to zero hit points, you can spend a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to be reduced to one instead. Then roll your Hunter's Die four times, add your Wisdom modifier, and regain hit points equal to the total rolled.

activation.condition: When you would be reduced to zero hit points

optionalfeature.name: Tactical Hunter
entries: If you have used your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to take another. You can use only one reaction per triggering event.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter of the Planes
entries: You are trained to protect yourself from supernatural effects. You cannot be possessed.

Additionally, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to reroll a saving throw against being {@condition Charmed|XPHB} or {@condition Frightened|XPHB}. You must use the new roll.

optionalfeature.name: Favoured Terrain: Outer Planes
entries: You feel most comfortable when things are strange. In environments on other planes, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival|XPHB}) checks, you cannot become lost outside of magical means, {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} does not slow your travel, you can forage for food in any environment, and while tracking other creatures you can learn their number and when they last passed through the area.

Furthermore, you can spend one {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} to roll your Hunter's Die to identify supernatural danger. If you roll 4 or higher, you learn if you are being watched and how.

activation.condition: When you feel you are being watched....

optionalfeature.name: Supernatural Defenses
entries: Your exposure to creatures from other planes has taught you how to resist their powers. You become resistant to necrotic, radiant, and psychic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Banishing Strike
entries: When you hit an Aberration, Celestial or Fiend with an attack, you can attempt to drive them away. Once per {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can spend two Instinct to cast the {@spell Banishment|XPHB} spell on the target. Success or fail, the target takes additional damage equal to two rolls of your Hunter's Die.

activation.condition: When you attempt to Banish a Celestial, Aberration, or Fiend

optionalfeature.name: Attunement with the Planes
entries: Once per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can cast the {@spell Plane Shift|XPHB} spell, targeting only the Upper or Lower planes, or the Material Plane. You do not require the material components.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter of Ghosts
entries: Borderland Hunters can pursue their foes even as they step into or through the Ethereal Plane. When you hit a creature with an attack, it cannot change the plane that it is on (for example, the {@spell Blink|XPHB} or {@spell Plane Shift|XPHB} spells) until the end of your next turn.
If you see a creature teleport, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to your speed in pursuit of it.

optionalfeature.name: Favoured Terrain: Borderlands
entries: You are experienced travelling the lands that border your own. When travelling through the Ethereal Plane or the Feywilds, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks, you cannot become lost, {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} does not slow your travel, you can forage for food in any environment, and you have advantage on ability checks or saving throws made to see through illusions.
Furthermore, in the Ethereal Plane, any vertical movement does not impose a movement penalty.

optionalfeature.name: Visions of Death
entries: Once per turn while using Ethereal Shift, you can replace an attack you make with an attempt to {@condition Frightened|XPHB|Frighten} a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see.

The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On failure, it becomes {@condition Frightened|XPHB} and takes two rolls of your Hunter's Die as psychic damage on a failure. On a successful saving throw, it takes half as much damage and is not {@condition Frightened|XPHB}.

activation.condition: When you replace an attack while using Ethereal Shift

optionalfeature.name: Ethereal Step
entries: Once per {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can cast the {@spell Etherealness|XPHB} spell on yourself as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. When cast this way, the spell lasts until the start of your next turn.
If you have already used this feature, you can use it again at the cost of four {@classFeature Instinct|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}.

optionalfeature.name: Halfway There
entries: When an attack would reduce you to zero hit points, you can make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to 5 plus the damage taken. On a success, you are reduced to one hit point instead of zero. You can do this successfully once per {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.
You have advantage on Death saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter of People
entries: You are trained to find people, no matter where they are hiding. You can add your Hunter's Die to ability checks using the {@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}, {@skill Insight|XPHB} or {@skill Deception|XPHB} skills that are made to gain information from others.

activation.condition: When you attempt to gain information using the Intimidation, Persuasion, Insight, or Deception skills

optionalfeature.name: Favoured Terrain: City
entries: You do your best work where people are. In cities and other settlements, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks, you cannot become lost outside of magical means, {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} does not slow your travel, and you can find enough food to eat no matter where you are.
Furthermore, you have advantage on ability checks made to identify local customs and find secret or hidden pathways in the environment.

optionalfeature.name: Building Scaler
entries: You are practised climbing buildings and leaping between them. You have a climbing speed equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and your jump distance is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: No Way Out
entries: When you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Opportunity Attack}, it is {@condition Halted|Starlight} until the end of the current turn. If it's your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, it takes additional damage from that attack equal to your Hunter's Die.

activation.condition: When you hit your Quarry with an opportunity attack

optionalfeature.name: Alpha Strike
entries: Once per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} when you roll initiative, you can replace the result of your {@dice d20} roll with a 20.
When you do this, you can add your Hunter's Die to the attack and damage roll of attacks you make in your first turn of combat.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter of all Horizons
entries: When you cause a Beast or Monstrosity that is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} to take damage, you can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it becomes {@condition Frightened|XPHB} of you and will attempt to flee the encounter by the fastest available means. A creature can be forced to make this save only once per turn.

activation.condition: When you deal damage to a bloodied beast or monstrosity

optionalfeature.name: Favoured Terrain: Land, Sea and Sky
entries: You are adept at travelling the regions that most humanoids rarely do. When you travel through forests, plains, or regions with little solid ground such as the sky or large bodies of water, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks, you cannot become lost outside of magical means, {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} does not slow your travel, and you can forage for food anywhere.
Furthermore, you have advantage on ability checks made to control vehicle such as boats or airships.

optionalfeature.name: Exploit Weakness
entries: When you would get a trophy from a creature, you can forgo that opportunity to instead create one of the following weaknesses to take your target down:

items: One of the creature's resistances or immunities is removed until the start of your next turn.
The creature becomes {@variantrule vulnerability|XPHB|vulnerable} to your next attack.
The creature becomes {@condition Dazed|Starlight} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Adrenaline Rush
entries: While you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you add your Hunter's Die to all saving throws that you make.

activation.condition: When you are bloodied and make a saving throw

optionalfeature.name: Thrill of the Hunt
entries: At the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to one roll of your Hunter's Die plus your Wisdom modifier if you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} and have at least one {@variantrule Hit Point|XPHB}.

activation.value: When you are bloodied and start your turn

optionalfeature.name: Hunter of Fables
entries: You are trained to fight all manner of creatures, from the fantastical to the real. When you roll initiative, you can make a Wisdom ({@skill Survival|XPHB}) or Intelligence ({@skill Nature|XPHB}) ability check to determine either the Traits or Legendary Actions of a creature you can see, with a DC equal to 10 plus the creature's CR (maximum 30). You can add your Hunter's Die to this roll.

activation.condition: When you roll initiative

optionalfeature.name: Favoured Terrain: Myths
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival|XPHB}) checks in environments that are home to Legendary creatures - such as volcanoes, the deepest caves, barren wastes or vast swamps. In such locations, you cannot become lost outside of magical means, {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} does not slow your travel, you can forage for food in any conditions, and while tracking other creatures you can learn their number and when they last passed through the area.
Furthermore, you have advantage on any saving throws made against environmental hazards such as heat or cold.

optionalfeature.name: Previvify
entries: You can use an {@action Action|XPHB} on your turn to revive a friendly creature within your reach who is at zero hit points. They regain hit points equal to twice your Hunter level and gain the benefits of your {@subclassFeature Rally|Hunter|Starlight|Fable|Starlight|7|Starlight} and {@subclassFeature Commander|Hunter|Starlight|Fable|Starlight|3|Starlight} features (movement only). Once you have used this feature, you cannot do so again until you complete a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Exploit Opening
entries: You guide your allies to success through your knowledge of these legendary creatures. Once per {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, when your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight} succeeds a saving throw against one of your allies' effects, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cause it to take force damage equal to four rolls of your Hunter's Die.

activation.condition: When your Quarry succeeds a saving throw against an ally

optionalfeature.name: Slayer of Legends
entries: When a Legendary creature is your {@classFeature Quarry|Hunter|Starlight|1|Starlight}, your Hunter's Die becomes {@dice 2d8} instead of {@dice 1d12}.
